c74object.name: cage.ezsampler~
c74object.description: Quickly turn bach.roll or bach.score into augmented samplers, associating and properly play soundfiles stored as slot content.

objarg.name: voices
objarg.description: The optional argument sets the maximum number of voices, as for poly~.

method.name: format
method.description:
A format message sends through the third outlet the proper slotinfo information which should be set to the bach.roll or bach.score. Such information formats the slots in the following way: Slot 1 - Function slot - hotkey: A - Amplitude envelope in decibels
Slot 2 - Soundfiles list slot - hotkey: F - Associated files (the active one will be played)
Slot 3 - Function slot - hotkey: Q - Pan envelope (from -1 to 1)
Slot 4 - Float slot - hotkey: S - Starting point in soundfile (in ms)
Slot 5 - Float slot - hotkey: D - Speed rate
Slot 6 - Filter slot - hotkey: W - Filter
You are also provided with a command, on the hotkey Z, which immediately stops all the notes being played.

method.name: llll
method.description:
An llll in the inlet is expected to contain the messages coming from bach.roll's or bach.score's playout. The content of the slots is then used to properly play soundfiles. The expected nature of the slots must be the following one:
Slot 1 - Function slot - Amplitude envelope in decibels
Slot 2 - Soundfiles list slot - Associated files (the active one will be played)
Slot 3 - Function slot - Pan envelope (from -1 to 1)
Slot 4 - Float slot - Starting point in soundfile (in ms)
Slot 5 - Float slot - Speed rate
Slot 6 - Filter slot - Filter
Such configuration can be easily obtained via the format message.

method.name: readfolder
method.description: All the used soundfiles should be placed inside a single folder. The readfolder message loads the content of these files into RAM.

method.name: stop
method.description: A stop message immediately stops all the soundfiles currently being played.

attribute.name: parallel
attribute.description: Toggles the parallel processing of each note, as for poly~.

attribute.name: transp
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to transpose each soundfile, depending on the note pitch (and with respect to a base pitch defined via the transpbase attribute). By default this is active.

attribute.name: transpbase
attribute.description: Sets a base pitch corresponding to "No Transposition". Default is 6000. This is only used if transp is active.

attribute.name: voices
attribute.description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneous voices.
